TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed ArgumentSemantic extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Represents the assignment semantics for properties.
Docs.remarks: This is used to flag the behavior of properties when objects are assigned, these are used by the MonoTouch runtime to properly track used objects and to garbage collect them when they are no longer required.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype ObjCRuntime.ArgumentSemantic Assign = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Assigning is merely a pointer copy.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype ObjCRuntime.ArgumentSemantic Copy = int32(1)

Docs.summary: A copy of the object is made.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype ObjCRuntime.ArgumentSemantic None = int32(-1)
.field public static literal valuetype ObjCRuntime.ArgumentSemantic Retain = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The object increases the reference count of the passed object.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype ObjCRuntime.ArgumentSemantic Strong = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The object increases the reference count of the passed object (modern name for â€œRetain").

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype ObjCRuntime.ArgumentSemantic UnsafeUnretained = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Merely performs a pointer copy in unmanaged code (modern name for "Assign").

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype ObjCRuntime.ArgumentSemantic Weak = int32(3)

Docs.summary: Weak properties can be cleared and their value updated.
